column1: The Mexican government has announced a four stage "traffic light" approach to re-opening activities based on COVID-19 levels. Each state is designated as one of four colored lights, red, orange, yellow or green, signifying the level of COVID-19 alert. Right now BCS is designated as the "Maximum Alert Level (Red light)" and the governor has announced that if that does not change by June 1st, current restrictions will remain in effect. The level of COVID-19 cases in BCS is designated as stable right now (not increasing or decreasing). If the alert level drops to "High Alert (Orange Light), some non-essential activities could be allowed but at a restricted level. (Source: Cabo Mil News)

Cabo Mil NewsLike This Page · 17 hrs ·  #NEWSBRIEF The Ministry of Health reports that BCS is marked as a red region in the newly announced COVID-traffic light, which will regulate the return to the “New Normality”, making it impossible to restart activities on June 1st. Based on this, State Governor, Carlos Mendoza Davis, reported through his social networks that, if everybody works responsibly, stands in solidarity and reduces risks, we may have a reopening date.Governor Mendoza emphasized that the return to regular activities depends on everyone, hoping that citizens show their support to reduce the number of infections by complying with the sanitary measures established by the authorities and maintaining social confinement.The newly announced COVID-19 traffic light will regulate the return to the "new normality" in Mexico and will go into effect on June 1. This means that the return of states and municipalities to economic, social and cultural activities will be determined, following the status of each state and municipality. Based on the traffic light, the date and mitigation measures will be designated: it will operate by region and will be updated weekly. The traffic light consists of four colors: red, orange, yellow and green. The following conditions will be evaluated based on this color-scale:The status of open air and closed public areas.Public health and work safety measuresThe allowed activities, whether essential or non-essentialThe situation of people with vulnerability conditionsSchool activitiesToday, during this morning’s press conferences of both President Andrés Manuel López Obrador and the Ministry of Health, it was announced that the authorities will issue weekly updates regarding the color that each state is in and, accordingly, specific measures will be followed. Specific activities and conditions apply to each color on the COVI-19 traffic light code.Areas marked as Red will only allow essential activities. Noting that as of June 1st three new sectors will be added to the essential activities list. The three new sectors are; mining, construction, and transportation manufacturing.Areas marked as Orange will allow Non-essential activities in reduced numbers. Activities in public spaces may restart, also on a limited basis. Vulnerable people may be integrated into work activities with the utmost care. Meaning that there will be protocols to reduce their work-hours and designate specific areas for them.Areas marked as Yellow will allow all work-related activities without restriction. There will be minor restrictions in open-air public spaces with greater restrictions in closed public spaces, such as cinemas, restaurants and theaters. Schools, however, will remain closed.Areas marked as Green may return to normal activities including the reopening of schools.By: Claudia Velo for Cabomil News https:/…
